title: Whither Canada?
description: 'It's Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart', Famous Deaths, Italian Lesson, Whizzo Butter, 'It's the Arts', Arthur "Two-Sheds" Jackson, Cycling Race, and The Funniest Joke in the World.

title: Sex and Violence
description: Flying Sheep, French Lecture on Sheep-Aircraft, A Man With Three Buttocks, A Man With Two Noses, Musical Mice, Marriage Guidance Counselor, The Wacky Queen, Working-Class Playwright, A Scotsman on a Horse, The Wrestling Epilogue, and The Mouse Problem.

roles.char: Man banging on the ceiling with a broom

title: How to Recognise Different Types of Trees from Quite a Long Way Away
description: Court Scene, The Larch, Bicycle Repair Man, Children's Stories, Restaurant Sketch, Seduced Milkmen, Stolen News Reader, Children's Interview, and Nudge Nudge.

title: Owl-Stretching Time
description: A change from street clothes to swim trunks turns into a burlesque act; a karate class exercises defense tactics against fresh fruit; a man tries to buy a book about false teeth.

roles.char: animated man who wants to show his latest operation
Singer in the Cardiff Rooms, Libya
Fourth man who is interested in pointed sticks
Man who peeks into a beach hut

title: Man's Crisis of Identity in the Latter Half of the 20th Century
description: Confuse-a-Cat, The Smuggler, A Duck, a Cat and a Lizard (Discussion), Vox Pops on Smuggling, Police Raid, Letters on Vox Pops, Newsreader Arrested, Erotic Film, Cartoon - Charles Fatless, Silly Job Interview, Careers Advisory Board, Burglar/Encyclopaedia Salesman

roles.char: Shouting man with handkerchief on his head
Head of the Careers Advisory Board

title: It's the Arts
description: Sketches include: a German composer with an extraordinarily long name; crooks plan an elaborate scheme to buy a watch; a chocolate-company owner markets "Crunchy Frog."

roles.char: Man Stting Next to the Indian
Weedy Man in Pullover with National Health Specs

title: You're No Fun Anymore
description: Invaders from another galaxy turn Englishmen into Scotsmen. Also: a comedy about camels; a corporate board meeting.

title: Full Frontal Nudity
description: A pet-shop customer returns his dead parrot; a gang of female senior citizens attacks a town's young men; a young army officer who joined the service to water-ski tries to resign.

title: The Ant, an Introduction
description: A man with double vision organizes a mountain-climbing expedition; llamas are celebrated in a rousing Spanish song; a barber is afraid to cut hair; a couple's romantic evening is ruined by uncouth visitors.

roles.char: The Man with a Tape Recorder Up His Nose's Brother
A Man with a Tape Recorder Up His Nose

title: Untitled
description: Sketches include: Bank Robber in Lingerie Shop, It's a Tree, Ron Obvious, Pet Conversations, Gorilla Librarian, Strangers in the Night

title: The Royal Philharmonic Orchestra Goes to the Bathroom
description: A half-inch-tall man appears on a talk show; a town's women's guild reenacts Pearl Harbor; the entire Royal Philharmonic Orchestra retires to the restroom.

title: The Naked Ant
description: The 127th annual Twit of the Year Show. Also: Hitler and Himmler are guests for tea in a boarding house; a BBC broadcast is interrupted when a British minister falls into a fissure.

roles.char: Letter Writer Against Falling from al Building

title: Intermission
description: Among "historical" impersonations are Cardinal Richelieu as Petula Clark and Julius Caesar as Eddie Waring. Also: a police fairy tale; a vegetarian restaurant's menu, featuring a naked man with an apple in his mouth.

roles.char: Letter Writer Against the 'Mr. Atilla the Hun' Sketch and the Next Letter
Mr. Teabags, the Minister of Silly Walks
Theatre Critic for the 'Western Daily News'
Man with a cake stand screwed to his pelvis

title: The Spanish Inquisition
description: An offbeat look at the Spanish Inquisition; an unconventional version of "Wuthering Heights." Also: a jury plays charades while delivering its verdict; a man attempts to find one nontaxable pleasure.

title: Deja Vu
description: Sketches include: Flying Lessons, Hijacked Plane, Psychiatrist Milkman, Complaints, d?j? vu.

title: The Buzz Aldrin Show
description: A supersleuth bishop investigates a suspicious insurance business; an elderly couple construct a house that has no walls.

roles.char: East Midlands Poet Board Sales Manager
Man at Not at All Naughty Chemist's

title: Live from the Grill-o-Mat
description: Contestants vie for incriminating photos in "The Blackmail Game"; a boxer spars with schoolgirls.

roles.char: Butcher who is alternately rude and polite
man in a green baize apron

title: It's a Living
description: Sketches include: The time on BBC 1, School Prize Giving, Films by Mr. Dibley, Timmy Williams Interview, Election Night Special

title: The Attila the Hun Show
description: "The Attila the Hun Show"; a burlesque performance by government ministers; a documentary study of village idiots. Also: political groupies pursue MPs.

roles.char: Minister of Pensions and Social Security
Secretary of State for Commonwealth Affairs

title: Archaeology Today
description: A dissatisfied bridegroom tries to exchange his spouse; hunters pursue a terrifying mosquito; domestic problems interrupt the work of Beethoven, Shakespeare, Michelangelo and other creative geniuses.

roles.char: The Rev. Arthur Belling of St. Looney Up-The-Cream-Bun-and-Jam
Mrs. Dreary Fat Boring Old Git

title: How to Recognise Different Parts of the Body
description: A University of Woolamaloo philosophy-department meeting---the members of which are all named Bruce; an exploding penguin; a radio version of "The Death of Mary Queen of Scots." Also: advice on how to pick up a cosmetic surgeon.

roles.char: Interviewer with a hook for a hand

title: Scott of the Antarctic
description: Foam-rubber snow and a stuffed lion are featured in a scene from "Scott of the Antarctic"; a football match is waged between gynecologists and Long John Silver impersonators.

title: How Not to Be Seen
description: Conquistador coffee campaign; Repeating groove; Ramsey MacDonald striptease; Job hunter; International Chinese Communist Conspiracy; Crelm Toothpaste/Shrill petrol; Agatha Christie sketch (railway timetables); Mr Neville Shunte - railroad playwright; Gavin Millarrrrr writes; Film director/dentist Martin Curry (teeth); City gents vox pops; 'Crackpot Religions Ltd'; 'How not to be seen'; Crossing the Atlantic on a tricycle; Interview in filing cabinet; 'Yummy yummy'; Monty Python's Flying Circus again in thirty seconds.

roles.char: Priest the Most Popular Religion Ltd

title: Spam
description: World revolutionaries are quizzed about football scores; figures from works of art go on strike throughout galleries in England; the search continues for a cure for over-acting; Viking marauders kidnap Englishmen who ask for canned ham.

title: Royal Episode 13
description: Miners brawl over historical facts; hospital patients serve the doctors; five shipwrecked mariners decide whom they will have for dinner.

title: Njorl's Saga
description: A courteous murderer wins a suspended sentence by virtue of his charm; a search for Paris by way of Iceland is interrupted by a plane crash and a shipwreck. Also: how to dispose of pets before going on vacation.

title: Mr. and Mrs. Brian Norris' Ford Popular
description: A couple investigate the cultural similarities between two London districts, seven miles apart; schoolboys' extracurricular activities are examined; a TV farming club comments on Tchaikovsky.

title: The Money Programme
description: "The Money Program" features a Swiss banker, a city accountant and a song of praise.

title: Blood, Devastation, Death, War and Horror
description: A program called "Blood, Devastation, Death, War and Horror," featuring a man who speaks exclusively in anagrams; a timorous TV announcer, before and after he undergoes psychiatric treatment; the employment of "pantomime horses."

title: The All-England Summarise Proust Competition
description: Contestants in "The All-England Summarize Proust Competition" are judged in swimsuit and evening-gown categories; an irate customer confronts his travel agent. Also: an expedition to Mount Everest, made by an international group of hairstylists.

title: The War Against Pornography
description: Surgical tools applied to a mildly anesthetized patient include a power drill and a mallet; a TV program features a lecture on gastropods, highlighted by the visit of a whelk.

title: Salad Days
description: A climbing expedition negotiates a hazardous London road; an attempt is made to determine whether an urban dwelling is a house or a lifeboat. Also: a mouse's quest for cheese, which leads to the production of a Western called "Rogue Cheddar."

title: The Cycling Tour
description: Mr Pither; Clodagh Rogers; Trotsky; Smolensk; Bingo-crazed Chinese (British Ambassador); 'Jack in a Box'.

title: The Nude Man
description: A housing project induced by hypnosis stands---as long as the tenants believe in it. Also: highlights of the Olympic Hide-and-Seek finals; suggestions for improving bullfighting, such as the use of radar.

title: E. Henry Thripshaw's Disease
description: A police investigator is mistaken for Sir Philip Sidney in a Tudor-period job agency, which actually deals in pornography; King Solomon judges the case of a stray bee; a panel of dead people debates the question "Is There a Life After Death?"

title: Dennis Moore
description: A highwayman steals "lupins" from the rich and tries to give them to the poor. Also: the first episode in a tatty, tedious 18th-century serial is brought to a screeching halt; peasants clamor for Titian paintings and Venetian glass.

title: A Book at Bedtime
description: 'A Book at Bedtime'; 'Red Gauntlet'; Kamikaze Highlanders; No time to lose; Penguins; BBC pro-gramme planners; Unexploded Scotsmen; 'Spot the Looney'; Rival documentaries; 'Dad's Doctors'; Dad's Pooves'.

roles.char: 'No Time to Lose Advice Centre' Consultant

title: The British Showbiz Awards
description: Oscar Wilde, James Abbott McNeill Whistler, George Bernard Shaw and the future Edward VII exchange epigrams at an evening party; mechanical brain surgery fails to dramatically affect a woman's mentality.

title: The Golden Age of Ballooning
description: The Montgolfier brothers prepare for the first balloon flight. Graham Chapman, Eric Idle, Terry Jones, Michael Palin, Terry Gilliam.

title: Michael Ellis
description: A shopper tries to determine the identity of a man being paged in a bizarre department store; a poetry reading is disrupted by Queen Victoria and Prince Albert.

title: The Light Entertainment War
description: A parody of war includes the invasion of Norway by tutu-clad commandos and a plea to the public to treat the war seriously.

title: Hamlet
description: Hamlet undergoes psychoanalysis; eight Queen Victorias compete in the Queen Victoria handicap race; a boxing contender gets his head knocked off.

title: Mr. Neutron
description: The search for Mr. Neutron, who plans to dominate the world, stretches from a London suburb to the Yukon, and results in the destruction of earthly civilization.

title: Party Political Broadcast
description: A spoof of British political-party broadcasts includes the finals of "the worst family in Britain" contest, a violent cricket match and a housewife who revolutionized beekeeping.

title: Montreux Special
description: Highlights of this special produced for entry in the 1971 Golden Rose of Montreux Festival include selections mainly from the second series such as "Scott of the Sahara"; the Gas Cooker sketch; the semaphore version of "Wuthering Heights"; the "Ministry of Silly Walks"; plus some new material including an exploding version of the "Blue Danube".
